claim_reports.claim_text: Fluoride lowers IQs, confirmed by a Harvard study published on July 27, 2012.
claim_reports.verdict_summary: Multiple high-reliability sources, including a Harvard study, indicate that children exposed to higher levels of fluoride tend to have lower IQ scores, consistently supporting the claim that fluoride lowers IQs.

claim_reports.claim_text: Another Harvard study published on July 26, 2012, finds fluoride lowers children's IQ.
claim_reports.verdict_summary: The evidence presents a mixed view on the claim that fluoride lowers children's IQ. While a systematic review indicates a decrease in IQ scores associated with fluoride exposure (PubMed), multiple high-reliability studies refute this claim, showing no negative impact on IQ from fluoride (Harvard studies, NTP report).

claim_reports.claim_text: Fluoridation of city water causes children's IQs to lower, leading to health problems.
claim_reports.verdict_summary: The evidence strongly refutes the claim that fluoridation of city water causes lower IQs in children. High-quality sources, including the American Dental Association, indicate that studies suggesting a link are flawed and do not support a causal relationship at the levels used in community water fluoridation. While one source presents mixed findings regarding higher fluoride levels, it does not establish a direct cause-and-effect relationship.

refutes.title: Fluoride Exposure: Neurodevelopment and Cognition
refutes.evidence_summary: The evidence indicates that while some studies suggest a link between fluoride exposure and lower IQ, the American Dental Association (ADA) and experts argue that these studies are flawed and do not support a causal relationship at the levels of fluoride used in community water fluoridation.
refutes.snippet: The meta-analysis found that for every 1 mg/L increase in urinary fluoride, there is a decrease of 1.63 IQ points in children. Using data from the high-quality ...

refutes.title: Fluoride and IQ - NPR
refutes.evidence_summary: The evidence presented in the article indicates that the claims linking fluoridation of water to lower IQ in children are not supported by reliable research. The American Dental Association asserts that studies suggesting a connection are flawed and that no evidence shows that optimally fluoridated water is harmful to children's cognitive development.
refutes.snippet: They conclude with moderate confidence that there is an association between higher levels of fluoride and lower IQ in children. The report didn' ...

refutes.title: Fluoride Exposure and Children's IQ Scores: A Systematic Review ...
refutes.evidence_summary: The evidence indicates that the systematic review claiming fluoride exposure lowers children's IQ is flawed and does not establish a connection between fluoride intake at recommended levels and lower IQ. refutes.snippet: Analysis of 13 studies with individual-level measures found an IQ score decrease of 1.63 points (95% CI, −2.33 to −0.93; P < .001) per 1-mg/L increase in ...

mixed.title: Fluoride Exposure and Children's IQ Scores: A Systematic ... - PubMed
mixed.evidence_summary: The evidence indicates that higher levels of fluoride exposure are associated with lower IQ scores in children, particularly from studies conducted outside the U.S. However, it does not establish a direct cause-and-effect relationship, and the current recommended fluoride levels in U.S. water supplies have not been shown to negatively impact children's IQ.
mixed.snippet: Importance: Previous meta-analyses suggest that fluoride exposure is adversely associated with children's IQ scores.

claim_reports.claim_text: The speaker claims that children in America have lower IQs due to fluoride in the water.
claim_reports.verdict_summary: The evidence presents a mixed view on the claim that fluoride in water lowers children's IQs. While some studies indicate a correlation between high fluoride exposure and lower IQ, major reviews, including those from the American Dental Association and a systematic review, argue that the data is insufficient to confirm adverse effects at the fluoride levels used in U.S. drinking water.

claim_reports.claim_text: A Harvard study published on April 5, 2006, shows a link between fluorinated water and bone cancer in boys.
claim_reports.verdict_summary: The evidence presents a mixed stance on the claim. While a study indicates a significant association between fluoride exposure in drinking water and osteosarcoma in males, other sources, including the American Cancer Society, refute a direct link between fluorinated water and bone cancer in boys. Additionally, a Harvard article raises concerns about fluoride's health effects but does not confirm the specific claim.

refutes.title: Impact of fluoride on neurological development in children
refutes.evidence_summary: The article discusses concerns about fluoride, including potential risks to health, but does not specifically mention a link between fluorinated water and bone cancer in boys as claimed. It highlights the need for further research on adverse health effects of fluoride, particularly on the developing brain.
refutes.snippet: 27 studies and found strong indications that fluoride may adversely affect cognitive development in children.

refutes.title: Water Fluoridation and Cancer Risk - American Cancer Society
refutes.evidence_summary: The evidence indicates that the study found no significant association between bone fluoride levels and osteosarcoma risk, contradicting the claim of a link between fluorinated water and bone cancer in boys.
refutes.snippet: A partial report of a study from the Harvard School of Public Health, published in 2006, found that exposure to higher levels of fluoride in ...

supports.title: Age-specific fluoride exposure in drinking water and osteosarcoma ...
supports.evidence_summary: The study indicates a significant association between fluoride exposure in drinking water during childhood and the incidence of osteosarcoma in males, particularly highlighting a peak odds ratio of 5.46 at age 7.
supports.snippet: Our exploratory analysis found an association between fluoride exposure in drinking water during childhood and the incidence of osteosarcoma among males.

mixed.title: Is Fluoridated Drinking Water Safe?
mixed.evidence_summary: The article discusses concerns about fluoride, including potential risks to health, but does not specifically confirm a link between fluorinated water and bone cancer in boys as claimed. It mentions that fluoride can concentrate in bone and alter tissue structure, which raises concerns, but does not provide direct evidence of a causal link to bone cancer.
mixed.snippet: Scientists linked high levels of naturally occurring fluoride in certain community water supplies to low levels of tooth decay.

claim_reports.claim_text: The nurse from Austin, Texas, claims that residents have white spots on their teeth due to over-fluoridation.
claim_reports.verdict_summary: The evidence presents a mixed stance on the claim. While city medical staffers refute the idea of toxic water fluoridation, several sources indicate that excessive fluoride can lead to dental fluorosis, characterized by white spots on teeth. This suggests that while fluoridation is intended to improve dental health, overexposure may result in the conditions described.

refutes.title: City medical staffers refute claims of toxic water fluoridation - Austin ...
refutes.evidence_summary: The article mentions that Austin fluoridates its drinking water to improve dental health, which implies that the claims of over-fluoridation leading to white spots on teeth are being refuted by city medical staffers.
refutes.snippet: Austin currently fluoridates its drinking water to help improve dental health, using dosage levels based on Environmental Protection Agency ...

supports.evidence_summary: The evidence discusses dental fluorosis, which is a cosmetic condition characterized by white spots or streaks on teeth, indicating that over-fluoridation can lead to such conditions.
supports.snippet: cosmetic condition where faint white markings or streaks may appear on the teeth. Fluorosis can affect both baby teeth and permanent teeth while they're ...

supports.snippet: If too much fluoride is consumed while the teeth are developing, a condition called fluorosis (white spots on the teeth) may result. Although most people ...

claim_reports.claim_text: The speaker believes that fear and anger can lower IQ by a couple of points.
claim_reports.verdict_summary: The evidence presents a mixed view on the claim that fear and anger can lower IQ. While some sources indicate that these emotions can impair cognitive functions and decision-making, suggesting a temporary reduction in IQ, others clarify that they do not provide specific quantification of IQ points lost. Notably, the Psychology Today article supports the claim by linking fear and anxiety to cognitive impairment, while another high-reliability source refutes the claim by stating that these emotions do not directly lower IQ.

refutes.title: Fear and Anger: Similarities, Differences, and Interaction
refutes.evidence_summary: The article discusses how fear and anger can affect attention and emotional well-being, but it does not provide direct evidence that these emotions lower IQ. Instead, it focuses on their physiological effects and how they can lead to emotional avoidance and constriction in emotional flexibility.
refutes.snippet: What are the similarities, differences, and interactions between fear and anger? Boost your emotional intelligence as you find the answers.

supports.title: Where Did My IQ Points Go? | Psychology Today
supports.evidence_summary: The evidence indicates that fear and anxiety can impair decision-making and cognitive function, suggesting that they can lower IQ temporarily by affecting the prefrontal cortex's performance.
supports.snippet: So that unconscious fear and anxiety residing in the amygdala can be blocking critical IQ and decision making resources without you knowing it.

supports.title: why are higher levels of intelligence in humans associated with lack ...
supports.evidence_summary: The evidence discusses how emotions like fear and anger can impair cognitive functions such as learning and memory, suggesting that these emotions can negatively affect intelligence, potentially lowering IQ.
supports.snippet: Highly intelligent people are portrayed as emotionless or in a way which implies that they do not know how to deal with emotion.

mixed.title: Effect of emotions on learning, memory, and disorders associated ...
mixed.evidence_summary: The evidence indicates that emotional responses such as fear and stress can impair cognitive functions, including learning and memory, which may suggest a potential impact on IQ, although it does not quantify this effect as a specific number of points.
mixed.snippet: Emotional responses such as fear, depression, and stress have impaired effects on cognitive functions such as learning and memory.

mixed.title: Relationships among stress, emotional intelligence, cognitive ...
mixed.evidence_summary: The evidence indicates that anger can negatively affect cognitive functions, as suggested by the mention of anger stress impacting full-scale IQ. However, it does not quantify this effect in terms of specific IQ points lost.
mixed.snippet: On the other hand, the full-scale IQ was affected negatively by anger stress, but positively by emotional application, showing the regression ...

transcript_data.text: hi everyone this is monty i've been doing some investigation into the floor nation of our uh water here in lebanon oregon and i got a letter from the harvard university they posted in the federal government's journal confirms that fluoride lowers iqs and that was on july 27 2012. you can you can most likely find it in uh just by typing in but you can see it's a major harvard university study that confirms that the fluorination of our city water lowers our children's iq now you would think that that would cause writing in the streets demanding that we would have fluoride removed from our water but ironically it doesn't another study this one done by harvard university on july 26th that says it was published in the national institute of health journal finds that fluoride lowers children's iq that's the florida nation of your city water and this is the article right here again it's a harvard university study now both of those were done in this year and you would think that as soon as the american people found out for sure through harvard university after they've done extensive studies that the fluoridation of our water supply causes our children redox retardation making our children's iqs lower causing problems and and families and health you think that people would uh be freaking out and getting the flu right out you think we wouldn't even have to ask our governments and our townships to remove the fluoride fluoride from our water they don't do it you have to fight tooth and now and chances are they're sterile aren't going to do it but if you're not worried about lowering iqs you know everybody says oh my kid's stupid you know we're used to hearing it but here's another release published in april 5th 2006 another one from harvard university studies shows a link between fluorinated water and bone cancer in boys so you know it just goes on and on it's just link after link all of these studies from harvard university uh not to mention the 3600 000 other studies that have been done by numerous people that just plagues this whole fluoridation of water and that people aren't doing anything about it they're not stopping it why is this being put in our water when it is causing the iqs of our children to be lowered causing uh all kinds of problems now here's a great thing me and my girl went to see her obgyn the other day and she had some work done on her while i was in the office i was talking to this specialist with women and children this lady is a doctor who specializes in child rearing and and women issues and stuff and i asked her what she knew about fluoride and she said that she strongly recommends that babies be fed special water that has been specially more foreign more fluorination put in the baby's water for the use of their uh for for their feedings and i asked her if she looked into it she said she felt some concerns about the recent stories of uh you know how fluoride is linked in in brain damage and she she said she hadn't really looked into it too much and i said well i just got you know i told her the story i just got this information on july 26 27th that uh from harvard saying that they definitely have confirmed it does lower uh children's iq and she said for years she'd been telling mothers of newborn babies to buy fluorinated water to feed their babies to put in their babies bottles so that their baby's teeth would be better and stronger well here's an interesting note the nurse that was helping this doctor says hey wait a minute uh i come from austin texas and they have natural fluorination of the water there where the water is over fluorinated and everybody in the town all the town of 300 000 people have white pitted stuff on their teeth and uh she said and everybody in the town acts literally like a bunch of dumbasses those are her words not mine she said that it's just a bunch of hooligans and everybody's kind of hillbilly mentality real low iq individuals and of course their waters naturally overflowed fluorinated it's called uh fluorination opmosis or something like that when you have too much fluorine in your body you get uh white spots on your teeth now here's just a thought if you know anybody with white spots on their teeth ask them a couple of simple questions and see if they're a dumbass because from what i hear from this nurse the people over in austin texas or somewhere around that uh all live in a town where the water has too much fluorine in it naturally and they're all a bunch of dumbasses uh hicks you know she this is her words not mine i i don't know i live in lebanon oregon and uh at any rate get sidetracked here there's all these studies out there saying that uh people who generally are angry and have gang-related problems and are fighting and are criminals usually have lower iqs people who are afraid when you become afraid your iq automatically goes down you lose a couple of points when you get really scared also when you get really angry you lose a couple of points you know it's briefly that's why people who get angry do stupid things what happens when you feed a baby from birth fluorinated water and they drink it their whole life haven't you noticed lately that our kids in america or just slightly not normal i have and i'm only 46 years old and i've noticed a huge decline in intelligence in our kids and i believe the world steady on children's iqs america's kids come in way under the mark like a hundred in the world our children that are being fed by by our country fluoride have the lowest iqs in in the world i mean there's a few countries that are lower in ours but i'm not even really sure there's anybody living there anyway these are just my views and they're backed with you know facts and i did talk to an ogbyn who said that she was recommending that babies drink specially high fluorinated water babies teeth fall out and they get new ones wouldn't it make more sense to wait until they were older to drink fluorinated water however fluoride isn't something that's brought in through the body system through digestion it's a topical thing if you go to a dentist the dentist puts it in a cup and sticks it on your teeth it's because it's absorbed through the teeth it's not absorbed through the body by drinking it and what what parts of it is is absorbed through it would require large amounts for it to do anything your teeth uh hence austin texas and then getting the white spots on their teeth look this stuff up it's on the internet i would like everybody to go and stop the fluorination of water and i think that we need to investigate how this stuff got put in and what is behind it now some people say well monty you're just a conspiracy theorist well that may very well be true but at least if i'm a conspiracy theorist then these people over in the harvard university need to be tarred and feathered because they're saying the same thing i am fluoride makes our children a bunch of retards anyways if you have any thoughts about this feel free to uh drop me a message also you know share this information and hit like on there and also uh subscribe thank you have a good day
